issues.title: Infinite Loop
issues.description: The `while True` loop at the end of the script will run indefinitely, preventing the program from terminating.

issues.title: Unhandled Exceptions
issues.description: The code lacks error handling.  Failures in file I/O, JSON parsing, or the external functions (`clean_string`, `process_articles`) could cause unexpected crashes without informative error messages.

issues.title: Inefficient HTML Parsing
issues.description: The HTML parsing is done multiple times within the loop.  Parsing should be done once per object and stored for later use in the content processing steps.

issues.title: Hardcoded Date Format
issues.description: The date format `%b %d, %Y` is hardcoded.  The script will fail if the input data uses a different date format.

issues.title: Inconsistent Text Handling in `match` statement
issues.description: The `match` statement handles different HTML tags inconsistently. Some add newline characters, others don't.  This inconsistency should be standardized for better readability and maintainability.

issues.title: Unused Variable
issues.description: The variable `named_entities` is assigned, but the commented-out `obj["word_counts"]` line suggests an intended use which is not implemented.

issues.title: Unnecessary Sleep
issues.description: The `time.sleep(100)` introduces a 100-second pause before prompting the user. This is unnecessary and likely a leftover from debugging.

feedback: The code attempts to process JSON data containing HTML, extract plain text, perform named entity recognition (NER), and convert dates. However, several critical issues, such as the infinite loop and lack of error handling, significantly reduce its robustness and usability.  Improvements in efficiency, error handling, and code clarity are needed.
